segment.source: How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: Use these instructions to recover a computer when you are physically present at the end-user computer that is experiencing problems.
segment.target: Use these instructions to recover a computer when you are physically present at the end-user computer that is experiencing problems.

segment.source: How to recover a local computer by using the DaRT recovery image
segment.target: How to recover a local computer by using the DaRT recovery image

segment.source: Boot the end-user computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0 recovery image.
segment.target: Boot the end-user computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0 recovery image.

segment.source: As the computer is booting into the DaRT 8.0 recovery image, the NetStart dialog box appears.
segment.target: As the computer is booting into the DaRT 8.0 recovery image, the NetStart dialog box appears.

segment.source: When you are asked whether you want to initialize network services, select one of the following:
segment.target: When you are asked whether you want to initialize network services, select one of the following:

segment.source: Yes - it is assumed that a DHCP server is present on the network, and an attempt is made to obtain an IP address from the server.
segment.target: Yes - it is assumed that a DHCP server is present on the network, and an attempt is made to obtain an IP address from the server.

segment.source: If the network uses static IP addresses instead of DHCP, you can later use the TCP/IP Configuration tool in DaRT to specify a static IP address.
segment.target: If the network uses static IP addresses instead of DHCP, you can later use the TCP/IP Configuration tool in DaRT to specify a static IP address.

segment.source: No - skip the network initialization process.
segment.target: No - skip the network initialization process.

segment.source: Indicate whether you want to remap the drive letters.
segment.target: Indicate whether you want to remap the drive letters.

segment.source: When you run Windows online, the system volume is typically mapped to drive C. However, when you run Windows offline under WinRE, the original system volume might be mapped to another drive, and this can cause confusion.
segment.target: When you run Windows online, the system volume is typically mapped to drive C. However, when you run Windows offline under WinRE, the original system volume might be mapped to another drive, and this can cause confusion.

segment.source: If you decide to remap, DaRT tries to map the offline drive letters to match the online drive letters.
segment.target: If you decide to remap, DaRT tries to map the offline drive letters to match the online drive letters.

segment.source: Remapping is performed only if an offline operating system is selected later in the startup process.
segment.target: Remapping is performed only if an offline operating system is selected later in the startup process.

segment.source: On the System Recovery Options dialog box, select a keyboard layout.
segment.target: On the System Recovery Options dialog box, select a keyboard layout.

segment.source: Check the displayed system root directory, the kind of operating system installed, and the partition size.
segment.target: Check the displayed system root directory, the kind of operating system installed, and the partition size.

segment.source: If you do not see your operating system listed, and suspect that the lack of drivers is a possible cause of the failure, click Load Drivers to load the suspect drivers, and then insert the installation media for the device and select the driver.
segment.target: If you do not see your operating system listed, and suspect that the lack of drivers is a possible cause of the failure, click Load Drivers to load the suspect drivers, and then insert the installation media for the device and select the driver.

segment.source: Select the installation that you want to repair or diagnose, and then click Next.
segment.target: Select the installation that you want to repair or diagnose, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) detects or suspects that Windows 8 did not start correctly the last time that it was tried, Startup Repair might start to run automatically.
segment.target: If the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) detects or suspects that Windows 8 did not start correctly the last time that it was tried, Startup Repair might start to run automatically.

segment.source: If any of the registry hives are corrupted or missing, Registry Editor and several other DaRT utilities will have limited functionality.
segment.target: If any of the registry hives are corrupted or missing, Registry Editor and several other DaRT utilities will have limited functionality.

segment.source: If no operating system is selected, some tools will not be available.
segment.target: If no operating system is selected, some tools will not be available.

segment.source: The System Recovery Options window appears and lists various recovery tools.
segment.target: The System Recovery Options window appears and lists various recovery tools.

segment.source: On the System Recovery Options window, click Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset.
segment.target: On the System Recovery Options window, click Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset.

segment.source: The Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window opens.
segment.target: The Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window opens.

segment.source: You can now run any of the individual tools or wizards that were included when the DaRT recovery image was created.
segment.target: You can now run any of the individual tools or wizards that were included when the DaRT recovery image was created.

segment.source: You can click Help on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window to open the client Help file that provides detailed instruction and information needed to run the individual DaRT tools.
segment.target: You can click Help on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window to open the client Help file that provides detailed instruction and information needed to run the individual DaRT tools.

segment.source: You can also click the Solution Wizard on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window to choose the best tool for the situation, based on a brief interview that the wizard provides.
segment.target: You can also click the Solution Wizard on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window to choose the best tool for the situation, based on a brief interview that the wizard provides.

segment.source: For general information about any of the DaRT tools, see Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0.
segment.target: For general information about any of the DaRT tools, see Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0.

segment.source: How to run DaRT at the command prompt
segment.target: How to run DaRT at the command prompt

segment.source: To run DaRT at the command prompt, specify the netstart.exe command then use any of the following parameters:
segment.target: To run DaRT at the command prompt, specify the netstart.exe command then use any of the following parameters:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: -network
segment.target: -network

segment.source: Initializes the network services.
segment.target: Initializes the network services.

segment.source: -remount
segment.target: -remount

segment.source: Remaps the drive letters.
segment.target: Remaps the drive letters.

segment.source: -prompt
segment.target: -prompt

segment.source: Displays messages that ask the end user to specify whether to initialize the network and remap the drives.
segment.target: Displays messages that ask the end user to specify whether to initialize the network and remap the drives.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: The end user’s response to the prompt overrides the –network and –remount switches.
segment.target: The end user’s response to the prompt overrides the –network and –remount switches.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Operations for DaRT 8.0
